byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Krün, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.
byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Group of 7 leaders reach agreements on greenhouse gas emissions and free trade expansion at meeting in Germany, but agenda is dominated by questions involving fight against Islamic State militants and how to address Russia's involvement in Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: Amid discussions on global security issues, President Obama headed home from the summit meeting with pledges from European leaders to reduce global emissions of greenhouse gases.

headline.main: Ukraine Crisis and Advance of ISIS Dominate Agenda for Group of 7
headline.print_headline: Crisis in Ukraine and Islamic State Dominate Group of 7 Agenda

snippet: Amid discussions on global security issues, President Obama headed home from the summit meeting with pledges from European leaders to reduce global emissions of greenhouse gases.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
